Class SatSolverTest

java.lang.Object
SatSolverTest
public class SatSolverTest extends Object
This class implement tests for the SatSolver class. Some of these tests seems trivial because they are testing the Sat4J-Api which is already tested. But with this test we can test our implementation using the Api to be clear that our interpretation and understanding matches the Api functionality. Also, this tests can provide some Usages with the SatSolver Class to learn using the SatSolver.

  • Constructor Details

    • SatSolverTest

      public SatSolverTest()

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      @BeforeEach public void setUp() throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      The setUp Method creates the cnf and adding it as rule set to the Sat Solver. As well as creating the possible models with the cnf.
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - is needed because we're adding new rules. By adding the rule, the rule set turns into a contradiction. See: Sat4J documentation

    • emptyConstructor

      @Test public void emptyConstructor() throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException, org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Test the Constructor with no parameter and add some rules manually later
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if the calculation takes too much time. See: Sat4J documentation
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - By adding the rule, the rule set turns into a contradiction. See: Sat4J documentation

    • isSatisfiable

      @Test public void isSatisfiable() throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      Testing for is not satisfiable is not possible, because adding a rule, that makes the rule set not satisfiable will throw a contradiction exception by adding the rule.
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if the calculation takes too much time. See: Sat4J documentation

    • isSatisfiableWithVar

      @Test public void isSatisfiableWithVar() throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      Test if two cases for the cnf where the rule set is satisfiable with some variables as Condition.
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if the calculation takes too much time. See: Sat4J documentation

    • isSatisfiableWithVars

      @Test public void isSatisfiableWithVars() throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      Test some cases for the cnf where the rule set is satisfiable with some rules as Condition.
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if the calculation takes too much time. See: Sat4J documentation

    • getModel

      @Test public void getModel() throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException, org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Test that the Sat Solver returns the same models as in this.modelForCnf. This test ask the Sat Solver for a model, checks if the returned model exists this.modelForCnf and then exclude this model by adding a new rule to the rule set(this.cnf).
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if the calculation takes too much time. See: Sat4J documentation
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - is needed because we're adding new rules. By adding the rule, the rule set turns into a contradiction. See: Sat4J documentation

    • getModelWith

      @Test public void getModelWith() throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      Test asking the Sat Solver for models with rules as condition
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if the calculation takes too much time. See: Sat4J documentation

    • addVariable

      @Test public void addVariable() throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException, org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Tests for adding NOT(1) as rule and then ask for satisfiability with 1 is true. Also test for a Contradiction by adding NOT(1) and 1 as rules
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if the calculation takes too much time. See: Sat4J documentation
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - By adding the rule, the rule set turns into a contradiction. See: Sat4J documentation

    • addRule

      @Test public void addRule() throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException, org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Tests for adding a new rule. Same procedure as testing addVariable()
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException - if the calculation takes too much time. See: Sat4J documentation
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - By adding the rule, the rule set turns into a contradiction. See: Sat4J documentation

    • getNVars

      @Test public void getNVars() throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Test for get the highest variable in rule set. We test the highest variable in this.cnf and then create a new rule set that contains the variables 1,2 and 7.
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException - By adding the rule, the rule set turns into a contradiction. See: Sat4J documentation
